comments:
Said, how do you add the new field into the data set?

the report XML that gives you error has issue in this line
        <script-data-set name="DataSet" id="3">
change it to 
        <script-data-set name="DataSet" id="16">

will solve the problem.

BUt if you are useing BIRT Design Engine API, then we need to know which API you use to add the additional column or modify the data set definition.
*** Bug 131302 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Said,

the problem seems that when you copy over the XML between <body> en </body> as it is from the old report to the new report,  the element ID is not updated.

In the old report XML, the first element in the <body> tag starts with 3, in the new report XML, it needs to start from 4, since 3 has been used by the new data set column.

Can you try open the old design (in stead of creating a new design) and insert the data source data set all via DE API?

This can be a solution, but the problem in my application is:
The code of open en fetch methods is dynamically generated, so
if the data set is updated then this methods must be generated again in order to reorganize the new data set elements in their code.Thus the script must be generated again. 

A solution can be:
Save the body of the script (<body>?</body>) via the API?s, and insert it also via the API?s into the new created report. 

Bu I don?t know if it is possible in BIRT to implement this mechanism (save and insert report body)?

How about use a work around like this,

1) change the element ids in <body> en </body> to start from 10000 manually.

2) use your existing program to copy over the <body> en </body> XML

unless there are more than 9999 data set columns, there won't be duplicate ids

To copy the xml from one report to another report design file is not recommanded unless you remove all copied element IDs from the target report design manually. If the xml is a library file, the ID is used to be referenced by an other report design file. And the ID is also used by the report document to generate the correct report view. If you reset the ID for whole design file, that might cause some unpredictable errors.

Change XML file manually means that the user of my program should do that, which is not the aim of this program. 

The aim of my program is:
The user has only the possibility to modify (create) the layout of a report.

Said,

Should have said programmatically instead of manually.  In your code, before copying the <body> XML over, look for id="..." strings in the <body> XML, and replace it with id="i", where i starts with 10000 and then i++.   It is not a general solution, we will look into supporting this type of usage (mix using birt API and copy XMLs to generate report design) in the future better.

I organize the ID for whole design file using Read and Write.
The ID begins with id=1 and id++.

Any idea what going here wrong?

For the last exception, I think you change the file out of eclipse work space. For example, you may change that file by Java standard IO on the file system. That causes the file out of sync with the workspace. Please try to refresh that file by right click.
